Label: Clinical code
Definition: A SNOMED code or a Local EMIS code (Coding 7689) depending on the 'code_type' field

Label: Type of code used in 'code' field
Date clinical code entered
Definition: Special coded values are given in Coding 819.

Label: Unit recorded for value
Definition: The unit for the recorded value, or a special coded value from Coding 1176.

Label: Value recorded
Definition: The value recorded, or a special coded value from Coding 2360.

Label: Clinical code
Definition: Depending on the value of the 'code_type' field, items are coded according to the Dictionary of medicines and devices (dm+d), or an EMIS Local Prescription Code (Coding 7678).

Label: Type of code used in 'code' field
Date of issue
Definition: Special coded values are given in Coding 819.

Label: Blood group of participant
Definition: The blood group has been extracted from imputed genotyped data (Showcase Data-Field 23165).

Label: Whether the requesting organisation is from an organisation known to provide acute (emergency) care.
Definition: Used in the construction of the 'origin' field.

Label: Whether the sample is recorded as being hospital acquired.
Definition: Used in the construction of the 'origin' field.

Label: The laboratory that processed the sample
Field (possibly) indicating whether the patient was an inpatient when the sample was taken.
Definition: This is based on information provided on the specimen request form and may not be reliable. See the COVID-19 test page on Showcase Essential Information for information about how this field is constructed by the data provider.

Label: Requesting organisation description.
Definition: Used in the construction of the 'origin' field.

Label: Whether the sample was reported as positive or negative for SARS-CoV-2.
Specimen type
Definition: Specimen type as recorded on the laboratory request form (e.g. nasal, nose and throat, sputum)

Label: Whether the requesting organisation is from an organisation known to provide acute (emergency) care
Definition: Used in the construction of the 'origin' field.

Label: Whether the sample is recorded as being hospital acquired
Definition: Used in the construction of the 'origin' field.

Field (possibly) indicating whether the patient was an inpatient when the sample was taken
Definition: This is based on information provided on the specimen request form and may not be reliable. See the COVID-19 test page on Showcase Essential Information for information about how this field is constructed by the data provider.

Label: Requesting organisation description
Definition: Used in the construction of the 'origin' field.

Label: Whether the sample was reported as positive or negative for SARS-CoV-2
Specimen type
Definition: Specimen type as recorded on the laboratory request form (e.g. nasal, nose and throat, sputum)

Label: The laboratory that processed the sample
Whether the sample was reported as positive or negative for SARS-CoV-2
The laboratory that processed the sample
COVID test unit person type description
Definition: Description of person tested (e.g. essential worker, inpatient, healthcare worker, education worker). Also provides additional information on whether the individual was asymptomatic or immunocompromised

Label: Whether the sample was reported as positive or negative for SARS-CoV-2
Specimen type
Definition: Specimen type (e.g. nose swab,  throat swab)

Label: Clinical code
Definition: A CTV3 code (Coding 7128) or Local TPP code (Coding 8708) depending on the 'code_type' field.

Label: Type of code used in 'code' field
Date clinical code entered
Definition: Special coded values are given in Coding 819.

Label: Value recorded
Definition: The value recorded, or a special value from Coding 5702.

Label: Clinical Code (dm+d)
Definition: Items are coded according to the Dictionary of medicines and devices (dm+d), or given a special coded value from Coding 4214.

Label: Date of issue
Definition: Special coded values are given in Coding 819.

Label: Date of death
Definition: Date of death

Label: Data source
Definition: The data source is either E/W for England & Wales or SCOT for Scotland.

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index used to distinguish the cases where we have multiple death records for a participant.

Label: Data format
Definition: The particular data format in which this record was received.

Label: Array index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid & ins_index uniquely identifies this record, i.e. eid, ins_index & arr_index together form a primary key for this table.

Label: Cause of death - ICD-10
Definition: Coded according to the International Classification of Diseases version 10 (ICD-10).

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid uniquely identifies the corresponding record in the main DEATH table.

Label: Classification of cause of death
Definition: Whether the cause of death is the primary cause or a contributory cause.

Label: Data provider
Definition: Whether the record originates from England (Vision), Scotland, England (TPP) or Wales.

Label: Date clinical code was entered
Definition: Special coded values are given in Coding 819.

Label: Read v2 code
Definition: Read version 2 code.

Label: CTV3 (Read v3) code
Definition: Clinical Terms Version 3 code.

Label: Data provider
Definition: Whether the record originates from England (Vision), Scotland, England (TPP) or Wales.

Label: Deduction date
Definition: The date of a participant's removal from GP list. Special coded values are given in Coding 819.

Label: Registration date
Definition: Special coded values are given in Coding 819.

Label: BNF code
Definition: British National Formulary code.

Label: Data provider
Definition: Whether the record originates from England (Vision), Scotland, England (TPP) or Wales.

Label: dm+d code
Definition: Dictionary of medicines and devices (dm+d) code.

Label: Date prescription was issued
Definition: Special coded values are given in Coding 819.

Label: Read v2 code
Definition: Read version 2 code.

Label: Methods of admission to hospital
Definition: Method of admission to hospital identifies how a patient was admitted, e.g. an elective admission from a waiting list or an emergency admission, etc.

Label: Methods of admission to hospital (recoded)
Definition: A field providing a unified coding across the various sources for the admimeth field.

Label: Sources of admission to hospital
Definition: Source of admission identifies whether a patient came to the hospital from their usual place of residence or elsewhere.

Label: Sources of admission to hospital (recoded)
Definition: A field providing a unified coding across the various sources for the admisorc field.

Label: Duration of episode within HES data year
Carer support indicator
Definition: Carer support indicator identifies whether a carer is available to the patient at their usual place of residence.

Label: Administrative and legal status of patient
Definition: Administrative and legal status identifies the type of patient and whether they have been formally detained under the Mental Health Act or not.

Label: Patient classification on admission
Definition: Patient classification on admission identifies the type of patient, e.g. whether they are a regular attender or a maternity admission, etc.

Label: Patient classification on admission (recoded)
Definition: A field providing a unified coding across the various sources for the classpat field.

Label: Destination on discharge from hospital
Definition: Destination on discharge identifies whether a patient was due to return to their usual place of residence on leaving hospital, or whether they were due to go elsewhere.

Label: Destination on discharge from hospital (recoded)
Definition: A field providing a unified coding across the various sources for the disdest field.

Label: Method of discharge from hospital
Definition: Method of discharge from hospital identifies how a patient was discharged i.e. whether this was on clinical advice, the patient died in hospital or the patient discharged themselves.

Label: Method of discharge from hospital (recoded)
Definition: A field providing a unified coding across the various sources for the dismeth field.

Label: Inpatient record origin
Definition: Either HES (England), PEDW (Wales) or SMR (Scotland). This can affect the coding used for some data fields.

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Date of decision to admit to hospital
Definition: Not available for dsource='PEDW', or for source = 68 (one of the formats for dsource='SMR').

Label: Waiting time for hospital admission
Definition: Not available for dsource='PEDW', or for source = 68 (one of the formats for dsource='SMR').

Label: Duration of episode
Definition: The difference in days between the episode start date and the episode end date, where both are given.

Label: Episode order
Definition: The position of this episode within a spell (starting at 1).

Label: Episode status
Definition: Whether the episode had finished before the end of the HES data-year. An unfinished episode would be replaced by its finished version when the data is next updated.

Label: Episode type
Definition: Hospital episode type identifies whether the period of care in hospital was, for example, a general episode, a maternity episode or a psychiatric episode.

Label: First regular day or night of admission to hosp
PCT where patients GP was registered
Definition: The PCT code identifies the administrative body where the patients GP practice is registered.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid uniquely identifies this record, i.e. eid & ins_index together form a primary key for this table. The ins_index will not generally index records in chronological order, and may contain gaps in the numbering if records were added and then later removed for some reason.

Label: Intended management of patient
Definition: The intended management of a patient is their planned duration of hospital stay, i.e. whether an overnight stay was anticipated or not.

Label: Intended management of patient (recoded)
Definition: A field providing a unified coding across the various sources for the intmanag field.

Label: Main speciality of consultant
Definition: The main speciality of the consultant is the specialism under which the consultant is contracted e.g. cardiology or geriatric medicine, etc.

Label: Main speciality of consultant (recoded)
Definition: A field providing a unified coding across the various sources for the mainspef field.

Label: Operation status
Definition: Whether an operation/procedure was carried out as part of this episode.

Label: Current PCT responsible for patient
Definition: The PCT code identifies the administrative body responsible for the patient.

Label: Inpatient record format
Definition: A finer split of the format of data released from each dsource above. This can also affect the coding used for some data fields.

Label: Beginning of spell indicator
Definition: An indicator that this episode is the first in a spell. Only present in English inpatient data (dsource = HES).

Label: End of spell indicator
Definition: An indicator that this episode is the last in a spell. Only present in English inpatient data (dsource = HES).

Label: Spell index
Definition: A numerical index indicating which spell this episode belongs to (where possible). Spells will not generally be indexed in chronological order.

Label: Spell sequence
Definition: A numerical index, starting from 0, giving the chronological position within its spell that this episode occupies (where possible).

Label: Treatment speciality of consultant
Definition: The treatment speciality of the consultant is the specialism under which the consultant was working e.g. cardiology or geriatric medicine, etc.

Label: Treatment speciality of consultant (recoded)
Definition: A field providing a unified coding across the various sources for the tretspef field.

Label: Array index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid & ins_index uniquely identifies this record, i.e. eid, ins_index & arr_index together form a primary key for this table.

Label: Resuscitation method
Definition: Resuscitation method identifies whether any procedures were required to get the baby breathing normally; for example: positive pressure (nil/by mask/by endotracheal tube) and whether drugs were administered.

Label: Birth order
Definition: No longer available for source=71 (April 2018) onwards.

Label: Status of baby at birth
Definition: Status baby identifies whether the baby was born alive or stillborn (ante-partum or intra-partum). No longer available for source=71 (April 2018) onwards.

Label: Weight of baby
Definition: No longer available for source=71 (April 2018) onwards.

Label: Delivery method
Definition: Delivery method identifies the way in which the baby was born; for example: spontaneous, forceps, breech or caesarean section.

Label: Delivery place
Definition: Delivery place identifies where the birth took place; for example: NHS hospital (with ward information) or at a domestic address.

Label: Status of person conducting delivery
Definition: Status of person conducting delivery identifies whether a doctor, GP or midwife was present at the birth.

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid uniquely identifies the corresponding record in the main HESIN table and the HESIN_MATERNITY table.

Label: Sex of baby
Definition: Sex of baby determines whether the baby was male, female or indeterminate. No longer available for source=71  (April 2018) onwards.

Label: Advanced cardiovascular support days
Definition: Number of days of advanced cardiovascular support. For the definition of advanced cardiovascular support see Resource 141140 or the NHS CC Data Dictionary.

Label: Advanced respiratory support days
Definition: Number of days of advanced respiratory support. For the definition of advanced respiratory support see Resource 141140 or the NHS CC Data Dictionary.

Label: Array index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid and ins_index uniquely identifies this record, i.e. eid, ins_index and arr_index together form a primary key for this table.

Label: Basic cardiovascular support days
Definition: Number of days of basic cardiovascular support.  For the definition of basic cardiovascular support see Resource 141140 or the NHS CC Data Dictionary.

Label: Basic respiratory support days
Definition: Number of days of basic respiratory support. For the definition of basic respiratory support see Resource 141140 or the NHS CC Data Dictionary.

Label: Source of admission to critical care
Definition: Whether the patient originated from the same or a different NHS hospital, an independent hospital provider, a non-hospital UK source, or a non-UK source.

Label: Critical care admission type
Definition: Whether a critical care period was initiated as a result of a non-emergency treatment plan, for example, for non-elective surgery. This relates only to the period of critical care and not to the nature of the hospital admission.

Label: Critical care APC relationship id
Definition: A comparison of the dates of the critical care period and those of the associated admitted patient care episode.

Label: Date of discharge from critical care
Definition: Discharge date from unit if alive, date of death or date of declaration of brain stem death.

Label: Critical care discharge destination
Definition: Whether the patient was discharged to the same or a different NHS hospital, an independent hospital provider, a non-hospital UK destination or to a non-UK source, or whether the patient died in the unit.

Label: Critical care discharge location
Definition: The principal location that the patient was discharged to for further care at the end of the critical care period.

Label: Ready-to-discharge date from critical care
Definition: The date on which the patient has been declared clinically ready for discharge or transfer from the clinical care period.

Label: Critical care discharge status
Definition: The patient status at time of discharge, for example whether they were fully ready for discharge, whether their discharge was early or delayed, whether they self-discharged, or whether they died rather than being discharged (and their organ-donor status if so).

Label: Critical care level 2 days
Definition: Total calendar days during which level 2 care alone was provided during the period.

Label: Critical care level 3 days
Definition: Total calendar days during which level 3 care alone was provided during the period.

Label: Location of the source of admission
Definition: The type of location the patient was in prior to the start of the critical care period.

Label: Date on which the critical care period started
Critical care unit function
Definition: The type of area to which the patient was admitted during a critical care period. This is the principal clinical service provided within the ward.

Label: Dermatological support days
Definition: Number of days of dermatological support. For the definition of dermatological support see Resource 141140 or the NHS CC Data Dictionary.

Label: Critical care record origin
Definition: Currently only HES (England).

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Gastrointestinal support days
Definition: Number of days of gastrointestinal support. For the definition of gastrointestinal support see Resource 141140 or the NHS CC Data Dictionary.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid uniquely identifies the corresponding record in the main HESIN table.

Label: Liver support days
Definition: Number of days of liver support. For the definition of liver support see Resource 141140 or the NHS CC Data Dictionary.

Label: Neurological support days
Definition: Number of days of neurological support.  For the definition of neurological support see Resource 141140 or the NHS CC Data Dictionary.

Label: Organ support maximum
Definition: Maximum number of organ systems supported at any one time, at any point in the critical care period (note that both basic and advanced categories cannot be counted at the same time). This may not be the same as the total number of organs supported throughout the critical care admission. The minimum for this variable is 0 and the maximum is 7.

Label: Renal support days
Definition: Number of days of renal support in the context of critical illness. For the definition of renal support see Resource 141140 or the NHS CC Data Dictionary.

Label: Critical care record format
Definition: A finer split of the format of data released from each dsource. Currently only 60.

Label: Critical care unit bed configuration
Definition: The composition of bed types for the critical care unit.

Label: Array index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid & ins_index uniquely identifies this record, i.e. eid, ins_index & arr_index together form a primary key for this table.

Label: Resuscitation method
Definition: Resuscitation method identifies whether any procedures were required to get the baby breathing normally; for example: positive pressure (nil/by mask/by endotracheal tube) and whether drugs were administered.

Label: Birth order
Definition: No longer available for source=71 (April 2018) onwards.

Label: Status of baby at birth
Definition: Status baby identifies whether the baby was born alive or stillborn (ante-partum or intra-partum). No longer available for source=71 (April 2018) onwards.

Label: Weight of baby
Definition: No longer available for source=71 (April 2018) onwards.

Label: Delivery method
Definition: Delivery method identifies the way in which the baby was born; for example: spontaneous, forceps, breech or caesarean section.

Label: Delivery place
Definition: Delivery place identifies where the birth took place; for example: NHS hospital (with ward information) or at a domestic address.

Label: Status of person conducting delivery
Definition: Status of person conducting delivery identifies whether a doctor, GP or midwife was present at the birth.

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid uniquely identifies the corresponding record in the main HESIN table and the HESIN_MATERNITY table.

Label: Sex of baby
Definition: Sex of baby determines whether the baby was male, female or indeterminate. No longer available for source=71  (April 2018) onwards.

Label: Array index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid & ins_index uniquely identifies this record, i.e. eid, ins_index & arr_index together form a primary key for this table.

Label: Diagnoses - ICD10
Definition: Diagnoses are coded according to the International Classification of Diseases version-10 (ICD 10).

Label: Diagnoses - ICD9
Definition: Diagnoses are coded according to the International Classification of Diseases version-9 (ICD 9).

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid uniquely identifies the corresponding record in the main HESIN table.

Label: Classification of diagnosis
Definition: The primary diagnosis is the main condition treated or investigated during the relevant episode. A secondary diagnosis is a clinically relevant contributory factor or issue that impacts on the primary diagnosis (including chronic conditions). An external cause is an environmental event causing injury, poisoning or other type of adverse effect.

Label: Gestation period at first antenatal assessment
Reason for changing delivery place
Definition: Reason for changing delivery place identifies whether a decision was made during pregnancy or labour, and the reasons for the change (address change, clinical or other reasons).

Label: Intended delivery place
Definition: Intended delivery place identifies where the birth was planned to take place; for example: NHS hospital (with ward information) or at a domestic address.

Label: Delivery onset method
Definition: Delivery onset method identifies whether the onset of labour was spontaneous or clinically induced.

Label: Anaesthetic delivered post delivery
Definition: This field identifies, for example, whether a general anaesthetic or an epidural was administered after labour or not.

Label: Anaesthetic administered during delivery
Definition: This field identifies, for example, whether a general anaesthetic or an epidural was administered either before or during labour.

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid uniquely identifies this record, i.e. eid & ins_index together form a primary key for this table. The ins_index will not generally index records in chronological order. The record in HESIN corresponding to a particular HESIN_MATERNITY record will have the same eid & ins_index.

Label: Mother age on date of delivery
Number of babies delivered from single pregnancy
Definition: No longer available for source=71 (April 2018) onwards.

Label: Array index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid & ins_index uniquely identifies this record, i.e. eid, ins_index & arr_index together form a primary key for this table.

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid uniquely identifies the corresponding record in the main HESIN table.

Label: Operative procedures - OPCS3
Definition: Operative procedures are coded according to the Office of Population Censuses and Surveys Classification of Interventions and Procedures, version 3 (OPCS-3).

Label: Operative procedures - OPCS4
Definition: Operative procedures are coded according to the Office of Population Censuses and Surveys Classification of Interventions and Procedures, version 4 (OPCS-4).

Label: History of psychiatric care on admission
Definition: History of psychiatric care identifies whether a patient has previously had a psychiatric episode in hospital or not.

Label: Detention category
Definition: Detention category identifies the legislation under which the patient was detained.

Label: Encoded participant identifier
Definition: This identifier is the same encoded id used in the main dataset.

Label: Instance index
Definition: A numerical index which together with the eid uniquely identifies this record, i.e. eid & ins_index together form a primary key for this table. The ins_index will not generally index records in chronological order. The record in HESIN corresponding to a particular HESIN_PSYCH record will have the same eid & ins_index.

Label: Legal status of patient
Definition: Legal status determines whether the patient was formally or informally detained and the relevant section of the Mental Health Act under which they were detained.

Label: Mental category of patient
Definition: The mental categories are in accordance with the Mental Health Act 1983; for example, mental illness, (severe) mental impairment, psychopathic disorder.
